content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Copper Mining and Smelting Setup at (-21, -74)
Consists of:
- Burner mining drill at (-21, -73) mining copper ore
- Iron chest at (-21.5, -74.5) storing copper ore
- Burner inserter at (-20.5, -74.5) moving ore to furnace
- Stone furnace at (-19, -74) smelting copper plates

### Iron Mining and Processing Line (-2, -76)
Consists of:
- Burner mining drill at (-2, -76) mining iron ore
- Complex belt system connecting components
- Iron chest at (-1.5, -74.5) storing iron ore
- Multiple burner inserters at (-0.5, -74.5) and (0.5, -74.5) moving materials
- Iron chest at (1.5, -74.5) storing iron plates

### Furnace Processing Line (3, -73)
Consists of:
- Two stone furnaces at (3, -73) and (5, -73)
- Multiple burner inserters:
  - At (3.5, -74.5) moving materials to chest
  - At (5.5, -74.5) handling furnace input/output
  - At (6.5, -72.5) moving processed materials
- Storage chests:
  - Iron chest at (3.5, -75.5) storing iron plates
  - Iron chest at (7.5, -72.5) storing iron plates
  - Iron chest at (3.5, -71.5) for additional storage
- Complex belt system connecting various components

ERROR TIPS

### Entity Placement Conflicts
- Cannot place burner inserter where one already exists
- Before placing entities, verify the target position is not already occupied
- Consider using different spacing or direction when placing entities near existing ones

### Entity Pickup Errors
- Ensure the entity exists at the specified position before attempting pickup
- Verify coordinates are exact when trying to pick up entities
- Double check entity type matches what you're trying to pick up (transport-belt in this case)

### System Design Considerations
- When creating complex production lines, plan entity placement carefully to avoid conflicts
- Consider spacing between entities to allow for inserters and belts
- Maintain clear input/output paths for materials flow
